title: MCP Server Architecture
content:
# MCP Server Architecture

## Overview

The Model Context Protocol (MCP) defines a standardized interface for AI models to interact with external tools and data sources.

## Key Components

### 1. Server
- Exposes tools via JSON-RPC protocol
- Handles tool execution and result formatting
- Manages connection lifecycle

### 2. Client
- Connects to MCP servers
- Sends tool requests
- Processes responses

### 3. Tools
- Defined with JSON Schema for parameters
- Execute business logic
- Return structured results

## Implementation Notes

- Use stdio transport for CLI integration
- Define clear tool descriptions for AI models
- Validate all inputs with JSON Schema
